08:37 <tmortagne> woshilapin: checking your rights  
08:38 <woshilapin> thanks  
08:38 <tmortagne> retry  
08:38 <woshilapin> Check also that I don't have 2 accounts (jsimard and woshilapin)  
08:40 <tmortagne> I checked jsimard's rights  
08:40 <tmortagne> could not find woshilapin  
08:40 <woshilapin> OK, perfect (was not sure for woshilapin so thanks for checking)  
08:40 <woshilapin> Released  
08:40 <tmortagne> ok  
08:41 <woshilapin> Now, documentation :-)  
08:41 <woshilapin> Will it be available on maven-xwiki immediately?  
08:42 <woshilapin> (I'm trying this http://extensions.xwiki.org/xwiki/bin/view/ExtensionCode/ImportExtension?parent=Extension.WebHome&template=ExtensionCode.ExtensionTemplate&importExtension=true&extensionId=org.xwiki.contrib%3Aapi-xff&repositoryId=maven-xwiki)  
08:42 <silverdrop> has quit  
08:43 <tmortagne> woshilapin: clicking Release literally means putting it on maven.xwiki.org  
08:43 <silverdrop> has joined #xwiki  
08:43 <woshilapin> ok, then I should be able to import it from e.x.o...  
08:44 <tmortagne> you can update it right away yes  
08:44 <tmortagne> you don't need to go trough import UI  
08:45 <tmortagne> you have a green update button in your extension page  
08:45 <tmortagne> (also it's automatically updated every night)  
08:45 <woshilapin> OK

10:33 <mflorea> vmassol: I'm not sure where to document the home page changes. They are not specific to Flamingo as you will notice them with Colibri too. It's not only about the dashboard app, because we changed the welcome message too. I'll just update the screenshots from the Flamingo Skin extension for now  
10:34 <vmassol1> yes that seems good for now  
10:34 <vmassol1> we don't have a XE flavor on exo ATM  
10:34 <vmassol1> is now known as <vmassol>  
10:34 <mflorea> yes

11:02 <tmortagne> vmassol: actually we do  
11:03 <tmortagne> http://extensions.xwiki.org/xwiki/bin/view/Extension/XWiki+Enterprise+-+UI+-+Main+wiki  
11:03 <tmortagne> gdelhumeau added it so that it could be found by the flavor manager

11:03 <vmassol> need to fix the title too  
11:03 <vmassol> (in meeting)

11:04 <vmassol> (title is ok actually)  
11:04 <Enygma`> has joined #xwiki  
11:04 <mflorea> ok, I'll add a screenshot there too  
11:08 <Enygma`> has quit  
11:09 <Enygma`> has joined #xwiki  
11:11 <vmassol> note: there are 7 issues withut fix version and related to NS. We need to decide if some shoudl go in 7.2  
11:12 <Enygma`> has quit  
11:12 <vmassol> going to move them to 7.3M1 for now  
11:12 <vmassol> let me know if you don't agree on some  
11:13 <vmassol> gdelhumeau: do we need http://jira.xwiki.org/browse/XWIKI-12569# for 7.2?  
11:13 <vmassol> see my comment  
11:14 <silverdrop> has quit  
11:14 <gdelhumeau> Ok I'm answering  
11:15 <silverdrop> has joined #xwiki  
11:17 <vmassol> we may want to do http://jira.xwiki.org/browse/XWIKI-12520# for 7.2 final, wdyt?  
11:18 <mflorea> +1  
11:19 <vmassol> ok putting for 7.2, we need a volunteer for it  
11:19 <mflorea> I can do it  
11:20 <vmassol> ok cool, you can assign yourself then. Thx Marius :)  
11:21 <Enygma`> has joined #xwiki  
11:22 <vmassol> someone also need to look at http://jira.xwiki.org/browse/XWIKI-12570#, maybe tmortagne?  
11:22 <vmassol> (no assignee ATM)  
11:22 <tmortagne> vmassol: I have no idea where to look exactly, I'm talking about it with Denis2 right now but looks like we'll need more information from him we we have no way to reproduce  
11:23 <tmortagne> s/we we/since we/  
11:23 <vmassol> ok you could assign yourself maybe, we need to be sure we have someone making the topic progress  
11:24 <Pbas> Hi talking about me ;-)  
11:24 <vmassol> yep :)  
11:24 <vmassol> could you check the comment from thomas on XWIKI-12570?  
11:25 <Pbas> Yes I'm on 7.0.1 : it is indicate at the bottoù of page  
11:25 <Pbas> \* bottom  
11:29 <tmortagne> Pbas: there is a script on http://jira.xwiki.org/browse/XWIKI-11355 to analyze security cache issues, would be great if you could try it when you reproduce again  
11:30 <tmortagne> hmm the issue is hidden, wait  
11:30 <Denis2> yes, you need to provide the script by another means  
11:31 <Pbas> Yes but I must wait that the bug coming? (write access is correct now)  
11:31 <Denis2> yes  
11:33 <gdelhumeau> vmassol: answered  
11:33 <Denis2> is now known as <Denis>  
11:33 <Pbas> Ok hope the bug come back soon :-)  
11:34 <Denis> Pbas: I just attached the script to the issue and explains basically how to use it  
11:34 <Denis> if you have any question on the procedure, you can ask me here  
11:34 <Denis> you can test the script before the issue arise, but what we will need is the output when the issue happen of course  
11:36 <Pbas> Ok then I will do both. It doesn't break somethong ? because it is my product platform  
11:39 <Denis> Pbas: the script is just an inspection of the document security and the state of the security cache, it could not harm, it has no side effect  
11:40 <Pbas> ok fine. I take Sandbox.CheckSecurity from jira ? becaut Thomas seem to modify same file :-)  
11:40 <Pbas> \* because  
11:40 <tmortagne> I did not modified anything  
11:40 <tmortagne> it's the same  
11:41 <Pbas> ok thxs  
11:41 <tmortagne> just make it available as extension  
11:41 <tmortagne> s/made/made/  
11:46 <Pbas> Then I must export result in PDF?  
11:50 <Denis> Pbas: screenshot, copy/paste (less readable) or print to PDF (by your browser), export to PDF could be difficult to achieve properly using the wiki… I should admit that there is room for improvement in this script, this has just started as a basic debugging tool  
12:00 <gsmeria1> has joined #xwiki  
12:15 <Ramona1> has quit  
12:15 <Ramona1> has joined #xwiki  
12:16 <gdelhumeau> vmassol: you want XWIKI-12332 in 7.2?  
12:16 <gdelhumeau> the UI part?  
12:17 <vmassol> in 7.2 we only need to fix broken stuff  
12:17 <vmassol> is there something broken in this issue?  
12:18 <gdelhumeau> vmassol: currently, we cannot import a document on a nested space  
12:18 <gdelhumeau> you can create Space.Doc but not Space1.Space2.Doc  
12:19 <gdelhumeau> the UI fix this  
12:19 <gdelhumeau> so I can backport it to 7.2  
12:20 <vmassol> you committed it for 7.3 already?  
12:20 <gdelhumeau> not yet  
12:20 <gdelhumeau> on a branch locally only  
12:20 <vmassol> ok  
12:20 <vmassol> if there's no risk for 7.2 final sure  
12:21 <vmassol> func tests will need to be updated too  
12:21 <vmassol> actually we probaby don't have any for office import...  
12:23 <gdelhumeau> yes I'm looking for it and I don't see any  
12:24 <gdelhumeau> oh yes  
12:24 <gdelhumeau> xwiki-enterprise-test-officeimporter  
12:29 <gdelhumeau> guys, xwiki-enterprise-test-officeimporter is not declared in the xwiki-enterprise-test module: https://github.com/xwiki/xwiki-enterprise/blob/master/xwiki-enterprise-test/pom.xml#L477  
12:29 <gdelhumeau> is it done on purpose?  
12:35 <gdelhumeau> the tests are broken because of refactoring that have not be done on it  
12:38 <gdelhumeau> hmm it seems that we should re-create this project with selenium2 and our current good practices instead of fixing it

14:31 <gdelhumeau> ok

14:32 <tmortagne> so yes I think we should just get rid of it and think of how to test office stuff, main issue being the office server

17:42 <bioGen\_X> has joined #xwiki  
17:42 <vmassol> has joined #xwiki  
17:44 <Denis> has joined #xwiki  
17:45 <bioGen\_X> Hi all, out of curiosity, has anyone attempted to install xwiki on centos7 with postgres or mariadb? I've been at it for two weeks now, and I can't seem to get anything up aside from the standalone package on centos7  
17:47 <bioGen\_X> I also noticed the tutorials for tomcat deployments are bit outdated, I mostly run into the 11007 error, where xwiki is either stuck connecting to the rdbms (mariadb) or stuck initializing at 50% (on postgres)  
17:49 <cjd> Are you already running tomcat for other purposes on the machien ?  
17:54 <bioGen\_X> no, this is being run on a vm only for xwiki  
17:55 <cjd> Ok, personally the way I would do this is #1 download the .zip instance of XWiki, #2 unzip it into a directory, #3 edit the hibernate.cfg.xml to point to mariadb  
17:56 <cjd> start it up and then download the .xar for the main XWiki Enterprise pages and import them.  
17:56 <cjd> Different people install XWiki differently, that's my method and I know that one to work.  
17:56 <bioGen\_X> okay, and this could still be done with the standard mysql jdbc connector?  
17:56 <bioGen\_X> or is that not a factor when using the .zip  
17:56 <cjd> do add the jdbc jar to the unzipped directory  
17:57 <cjd> actually before you tear down what you have, just paste the error in your browser to https://encry.pt/ and maybe it's something I know the error well  
17:58 <bioGen\_X> My other question is can I have Jetty from the .zip run in the background similar to tomcat? The VM becomes uninteractive when running the "start\_xwiki.sh" script to host xwiki, unless of course it is permissible to run the standalone on a production enviroment  
17:58 <bioGen\_X> Will do, thank you cjd.  
17:59 <Chuguniy|2> has joined #xwiki  
18:00 <OSIMasson> has quit  
18:00 <cjd> You need a restart-in-case-of-failure mechanism either way, for that you might consider looking at xinit.sh (google: XWiki xinit)  
18:00 <OSIMasson> has joined #xwiki  
18:01 <Chuguniy> has quit  
18:01 <cjd> well I'm heading home, maybe you can join the [[email protected]](https://dev.xwiki.org/cdn-cgi/l/email-protection) mailing list and discuss the issue there  
18:03 <bioGen\_X> Thank you for the help, I will continue to troubleshoot this on my end with what you have told me.  
18:06 <cjd> has quit  
18:06 <ClemensR> the standalone zip distro is no good in a production environment, but that is only because of the database it uses (HSQL) - you can reconfigure it to use mySQL instead (and then reinit all the data, of course ...) and that should be ok, except maybe for high load stuff  
18:07 <ClemensR> I found the debian package installer is also quite painless, but only works on debian, of course ...  
18:08 <ClemensR> what is the 11007 error, actually? I have to admit I never seen it  
18:11 <ClemensR> which tutorials are actually the outdated ones, and why are they outdated? (I tend to think they are fine, but then I likely miss the stepping stones out of habit, so it would be nice to know where they should be improved)  
18:23 <woshilapin> has quit  
18:24 <bioGen\_X> has quit  
18:31 <vmassol> ClemensR: I think he was referring to http://platform.xwiki.org/xwiki/bin/view/AdminGuide/Installation#HTutorials  
18:32 <ClemensR> ah, yes, mayeb, these external tutorials migth be updates; better use  http://platform.xwiki.org/xwiki/bin/view/AdminGuide/InstallationWAR   :)  
18:32 <ClemensR> ah, bioGen\_X already gone :(  
18:32 <vmassol> yep

19:19 <bioGen\_X> Hi, not sure if my previous message sent, but the tutorial that was outdated was a link to another website from xwiki, the tomcat tutorial is up to date that is hosted here. That being said, I have followed it, but am unable to deploy, start, or access via browser, my xwiki via tomcat (using postgres). The manager app says the application at context path could not be started for xwiki.

20:42 <bioGen\_X> Hi all, just wanted to thank cjd earlier for his help. I was able to deploy xwiki successfully by a) uploading the war via tomcat's webmanager b) setting up rdbms (postgres + connector) c) increasing mem limit on java headers and now it is up and running  
20:44 <OSIMasson> has joined #xwiki

20:55 <vmassol> you could use the mailing list to post questions/info about your issues and I'm sure you'll get some answers  
20:55 <vmassol> see http://dev.xwiki.org/xwiki/bin/view/Community/MailingLists
